title: Last layer state space model for representation learning and uncertainty quantification. (arXiv:2307.01566v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: As sequential neural architectures become deeper and more complex, uncertainty estimation is more and more challenging. Efforts in quantifying uncertainty often rely on specific training procedures, and bear additional computational costs due to the dimensionality of such models. In this paper, we propose to decompose a classification or regression task in two steps: a representation learning stage to learn low-dimensional states, and a state space model for uncertainty estimation. This approach allows to separate representation learning and design of generative models. We demonstrate how predictive distributions can be estimated on top of an existing and trained neural network, by adding a state space-based last layer whose parameters are estimated with Sequential Monte Carlo methods. We apply our proposed methodology to the hourly estimation of Electricity Transformer Oil temperature, a publicly benchmarked dataset. tldr: 本文提出了一种新的方法，将分类或回归任务分解为表示学习和不确定性估计两个步骤，通过添加一个基于状态空间的最后一层来实现预测分布的估计。该方法能够独立进行表示学习和生成模型的设计，适用于深层和复杂的顺序神经网络结构。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel approach to decompose classification or regression tasks into representation learning and uncertainty estimation, by adding a state space-based last layer to estimate predictive distributions. This method allows for independent representation learning and design of generative models, and is applicable to deep and complex sequential neural architectures.
